title: Former ITAK MP Mavai Senathirajah passes away
byline: Former Member of Parliament from ITAK, Mavai Senathirajah passed away a short while ago after suffering a brief illness.

title: SL defends legality of operations amid India protest
byline: While defending the legality of the Sri Lanka Navy’s conduct amid strong protests with Sri Lanka over an incident of firing by the Sri Lankan Navy, Defence Secretary Air Vice Marshal (Rtd) Sampath Thuyacontha said that Sri Lanka will continue to search vessels entering its waters, regardless of their country of origin, in accordance with legal protocols to prevent illegal activities.

title: Sri Lanka looks to turn to Indonesia for coconut product imports
byline: To combat the current coconut shortage, Sri Lanka looks at importing coconut products from Indonesia, an official said.

title: American Airlines jet collides with helicopter near Washington’s Reagan Airport
byline: An American Airlines regional passenger jet and a U.S. Army Black Hawk helicopter crashed into the Potomac River after a midair collision near Reagan Washington National Airport on Wednesday night, officials said.

title: Don’t panic over foggy conditions, advises medical specialist
byline: In light of the foggy conditions prevailing in many parts of the country, Consultant Respiratory Physician Dr. Neranjan Dissanayake urged the public not to panic, noting that such weather is not abnormal.

title: Current policy rate sufficient to bring inflation back to 5% target: CBSL
byline: In line with widespread expectations, the Central Bank kept its Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) — its new key policy rate — at 8.00 percent at its first policy meeting of the year.

title: Sri Lanka must shift from bailouts and handouts to export-driven growth: ADB
byline: Sri Lanka must focus on developing an export-oriented industrialisation policy rather than relying on bailouts and handouts for economic recovery, the Asian Development Bank (ADB) said yesterday.

title: NDF candidates who contested general elections to meet Ranil
byline: The candidates who contested the general elections in 2024 under the New Democratic Front (NDF) is scheduled to meet former President Ranil Wickremesinghe this evening, former MP Premanath C Dolawatte said.

title: Global cancer patients could reach to 30 million by 2040: Dr. Sudath Samaraweera
byline: Health authorities have raised concerns, predicting that by 2040, the global number of cancer patients could reach to 30 million.

title: 4,421 armed forces, police personnel to participate in Independence Day parade: Army Commander
byline: Some 4,421 personnel of the armed forces and police will participate in the Independence Day parade this time, Commander of the Sri Lanka Army, Lieutenant General Lasantha Rodrigo said today.

title: Rs. 80 million allocated to 77th Independence Day celebrations: Govt.
byline: The government has allocated Rs. 80 million for the 77th Independence Day celebrations, Provincial Councils and Local Government Minister Dr. A.H.M.H Abayarathna said today.

title: Independence Day Celebrations open to public this time: Minister
byline: The government has decided to open the 77th Independence Day Celebrations for the public to witness, Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government Minister Dr. A.H.M.H Abayarathna said today.

title: Man who burned Quran ’shot dead in Sweden’
byline: A man who sparked violent protests after burning the Quran has been shot dead in Sweden, according to local media reports.

title: Sri Lankans spend Rs. 690 million daily on arrack and beer: ADIC
byline: In Sri Lanka, the consumption of arrack and beer is significant, with people spending as much as Rs. 690 million per day on these beverages, according to the Alcohol and Drugs Information Centre (ADIC).

title: Former public administration ministry secretary arrested
byline: Former Public Administration Ministry Secretary Priyantha Mayadunne was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago.

title: Leprosy cases reported in Sri Lanka: 12% are children
byline: A total of 1,800 leprosy cases were reported in Sri Lanka within a year, with 12% of the patients being children under the age of 15.

title: Does not intend to stay in politics for long: Ramanathan Archchuna
byline: Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna, who has been in the centre of controversy, said today that he does not intend to stay in politics for long.

title: Fans fill stadium for Virat Kohli’s first domestic match in 12 years
byline: Thousands of fans filled a stadium in the Indian capital, Delhi, as Virat Kohli made his much-anticipated return to domestic cricket after more than 12 years.

title: Air pollution in Colombo raises respiratory health concerns: Pediatrician
byline: Due to air pollution in Colombo and its suburbs, there is an increase in health issues such as respiratory difficulties, coughing, childhood asthma and viral respiratory infections, Lady Ridgeway Hospital (LRH) Consultant Pediatrician Dr. Deepal Perera said.

title: US teen shot dead by father in Pakistan over TikTok videos
byline: A man who recently moved his family back to Pakistan from the US has confessed to killing his teenage daughter because he disapproved of her TikTok videos, police have told the BBC.

title: Nigerian nabbed with forged Ghanaian passport at BIA
byline: A Nigerian national was arrested at the Bandaranaike  International Airport, Katunayake by Immigration and Emigration officials while attempting to leave Sri Lanka using a forged Ghanaian passport last night (29).

title: Prof. Kapila Perera to oversee SLTB operations
byline: Senior Professor Kapila C.K. Perera, Secretary to the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation, has been appointed to oversee the operations of the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) with immediate effect.

title: Jaffna court grants permission for peaceful protest during President’s visit
byline: The Jaffna Magistrate’s Court today allowed a peaceful protest to be held tomorrow by the unemployed graduates of the Northern Province during the visit of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to Jaffna.

title: Four-day rapid container clearance process begins today
byline: The Sri Lanka Customs, with the full cooperation of joint trade unions, launched a four-day expedited container clearance process today, aiming to clear the backlog of containers destined for examination yards by February 2, Customs Media Spokesman and Additional Director General Seevali Arukgoda said.

title: Foreign pests suspected in coconut decline: Coconut Board Chairman
byline: It is suspected that the collapse of the coconut industry in this country or the reduction in coconut yields has been due to the influence of foreign invasive insects or bacteria, Chairman of the Coconut Cultivation Board Dr. Sunimal Jayakody said.

title: Do not intend to stay in politics for long: Ramanathan Archchuna
byline: Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna, who has been in the centre of controversy, said today that he does not intend to stay in politics for long.
